item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I do not understand the mystery of grace -- only that it meets us where we are and does not leave us where it found us." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "We shall find peace. We shall hear angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked. In a word, each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I can, with one eye squinted, take it all as a blessing." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When you learn, teach, when you get, give." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Travel is the art form available to Everyman. You sit in the coffee shop in a strange city and nobody knows who you are, or cares, and so you shed your checkered past and your motley credentials and you face the day unarmed ... And onward we go and some day in the distant future, we will stop and turn around in astonishment to see all the places we've been and the heroes we were." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates
